website_summaries.verdict: Good choice for soundproofing or cushioning a large carpet but may be too slippery for smaller area rugs or kitchen mats. Felt is exceptionally dense but may have a plastic backing not disclosed in description.
pros: Thick and dense 3/8-inch felt pad provides excellent sound proofing and shock absorption
Dense enough for a child's playroom
cons: No rubber layer, so rug pad is not slip-proof
Only slightly thicker than 1/4-inch standard pads
We recommend placing furniture on carpet to anchor the felt rug pad

customer_reviews.title: Just No
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely not recommend this product. I regret not sending it back immediately as it was an immediate disappointment and did not resemble the heft and quality in the listing photo. It is super thin (1/8 inches) and so fragile, the slightest friction causes it to come apart. My cat simply walking over it with her claws will put a large hole in it. Having had quality rug pads (thicker and denser) through several decades, I would rate this one a D at best. It has the loft of thin human hair and adds next to no cushioning. In the photo you can see the actual thickness and the fluff that is easily dislodged.
customer_reviews.author: conscientious consumer

customer_reviews.title: Ordered a size down and no cutting necessary!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 8" x 10" rug pad to go with a 9" x 12" rug. The pad is thick and has made my less expensive rug heavenly to walk on! One of my best Amazon purchases yet! I read in other reviews that people were having to cut their pads down, so I just ordered a size down and it worked perfectly! The bottom is slightly different, but I wouldn't say it's grippy. However, with the size I ordered grip does not matter. Sliding has not been an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible all around. First of all, it was not cut to the right size. It was too big. Second, the cuts weren't even straight. Person cutting it took zero effort. Third, this sheds like mad. My house is now covered in fragments from this pad. Finally, this did not seem to even be a genuine rug pad. It is basically the same padding they put under wall to wall carpeting. Needless to say, this was returned. Save yourself the hassle and get a better one.
customer_reviews.author: randomman

customer_reviews.title: Not like the picture at all
customer_reviews.text: This is so interesting how the reviews are so divided. I will say this – the pictures incredibly deceiving! It looks so thick! This is super thin. I would say for those wondering, it’s not soft and not cushioning at all. It does definitely move around so you would need something else underneath it. Honestly, I could’ve saved myself money and just gotten carpet padding at Home Depot and it would’ve done probably a better job. I’m bummed because it looked great in the pics!
customer_reviews.author: Rie

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and substantial
customer_reviews.text: Makes my cheap acrylic rugs feel like wool and my nice wool rugs like a fresh buttermilk biscuit.
customer_reviews.author: S. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Good Rug Pad!
customer_reviews.text: This rug pad is very thick and makes our wool rug feel even more cushioned and comfortable to walk on. I sent the seller a request online after I ordered it right on the Amazon order page to cut the pad so that it would fit underneath our 8 X 10 rug without me having to try to do it. The seller promptly replied that they would be happy to trim the pad one inch on all sides for free. The pad fits perfectly under the rug! I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Inspector 12

customer_reviews.title: Caution NOT ANTI SLIP
customer_reviews.text: I missed the mention that this pad needs something to prevent slipping and seriously almost broke my neck. My whole 5x7 carpet became like a Hoover craft as I slid from living room to kitchen. Great if I were Aladdin but just a middle aged white girl with low bone density. Luckily I had a brand new gripper in my shame closet of impulse buys. So the pad otherwise is great. Nice and thick, cushy and comfy to walk on. Made my 100.00 rug feel like a thousand bucks!
customer_reviews.author: bigdeal

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made .HALF of one side has a hard, burned plastic stuff coating it. I believe that it was heated to a high temp. to melt it. The other half is soft felt. There are also black flakes throughout one side, which fall out and get on everything. I'm sure the hard side would eventually scratch my floors, so can't use this as one piece. Too big and bulky to easily wrap or box up to return, so I just cut it up and used what I could on smaller rugs. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Marjie

customer_reviews.title: Cats will congregate on your rug
customer_reviews.text: Makes it better to walk on. I put it under a rug that I recently purchased from another site. However now it is inherently clear that I am a cat lady to anyone who comes in the door. Since they seem to congregate in one spot now. The rug. Plotting the demise of this world in comfort and style. You have been warned. Also it's a good deterrent from your pets slipping out the front door when you bring in groceries.. as they will be asleep on the floor not giving a crap about your bags of snacks.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Great rug pad!
customer_reviews.text: I did not even know that this product existed until my daughter told me about it. Our rug was scrunching up and sliding all over our new hardwood floor, which of course was not desirable. Now, with the felt pad, it not only stays in place (with some help from the furniture), but it feels great to walk on. I love it!! Size was perfect. My one suggestion to the company is to make it clear about which side goes up or down, because the pad's sides are obviously different. (Hint, after a web search we learned that the soft/felt side should be on the floor, but it would have been helpful to know that when we opened the box!)
customer_reviews.author: JET

customer_reviews.title: This rug pad arrived with garbage rolled up in it. Black mildew, dirty, & smelly
customer_reviews.text: What in the world? This rug pad was packaged perfectly, but when I took out of plastic wrapping and unrolled and unfolded it, it was awful. black spots, dirt and wrapper pieces - like candy wrappers on it. It is very discolored with blackish patches. It smells. I don't know where this came from, ordered on amazon, lots of trouble to try to package up to send back. What to do with this? It looks like it has definitely been used before. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of the 5x8 rugs. One for my dining room and one for my living room. They are exactly as described and fit perfectly under my new 5x8 rugs. They add a lot of cushion and are soft. I have furniture (at least partially) on the rugs, so I can't comment on whether or not they slide around. I've been checking since I purchased and neither have stuck to my maple hardwood floors and neither have left a mark. I hope this review is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Stella16

customer_reviews.title: Safe for luxury vinyl floors
customer_reviews.text: I needed a felt pad for under my breakfast room table after I had luxury vinyl tile installed. The pad is perfect. Fortunately, my floor installers put it down and cut the circumference a couple of inches to fit. My only suggestion is to make these an 1-1/2 inches smaller than standard rug sizes. I bought one circular and one rectangular pad and highly recommend both.
customer_reviews.author: Curious in TN

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: This is fine but definitely not extra thick. I bought another smaller pad not advertised as thick and it was thicker and more comfortable than this one. I mean its fine but I walk across the other one to get to my bedroom then walk on this one and its a disappointment every time lol and I bought two of them no less. These came well packed, no problems, folded up, unfolds and lays flat easy enough, I had to trim a little and it was easy. So its fine, but not extra thick or comfortable in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Thornwood Mom

customer_reviews.title: Beware of False Advertisement!
customer_reviews.text: Falsely advertised! I ordered 2 of them in the 8 x 10 and while they seem okay, they are not the thick 3/8" pad that is advertised. They are much thinner at only 1/4" (or less). I already opened the one and put it under a rug so I am stuck with it, but I am returning the other. I ordered this same pad in a 6 x 9 and it is nice, thick and 3/8". It feels very cushy under my rug - which is what I wanted for all of my rugs. I feel a bit scammed since I paid for the 3/8" but only got 1/4".......
customer_reviews.author: Carol Sellner

customer_reviews.title: Best rug pad I’ve ever tried! Buy smaller size!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried many rug pads and this has to be the best one I’ve ever tried! I would order a size down because you will have to cut the excess down regardless. I used this with carpet tape to keep the rug in place and it’s perfect. Please note- this isn’t for your rug to stay in place, it’s only a pad but the carpet tape isn’t expensive and will help with this. (I have hardwood floors and a dog and it’s been fantastic!)
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Pile is only 1/4", not 3/8" as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This pad is more like 1/4". Definitely not 3/8" as advertised (see image). Very compressible too. Did Rug Pad Central send me 1/4" by mistake instead of the 3/8" I ordered? I would love to be able to reach out directly to the seller but the only way seems to be via leaving feedback. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: skunther

customer_reviews.title: This is just right. I suggest it for a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is just right. I suggest it for a thinner Persian. It is slightly out of square. It comes folded in quarters then rolled. Expect some fold-bumps. What we did: lay it out to an inch in from the edge of the carpet. And we only made sure that one side was Square. Then we taped it down. Then we're laying the carpet over it. And then Will determine how much we have to trim because even though the carpet gives specific dimensions, my experiences there always a little bit different than the actual dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: ClubFisher

customer_reviews.title: Almost identical to our other pad, at 1/3 the cost.
customer_reviews.text: We have three other rugs with pads we purchased from an online retailer. This pad from Amazon was a slightly different color, but other than that identical to the others. The difference is we paid a couple hundred more for the other pads. So glad we found this on Amazon! We have composite Lifeproof floors so I can speak to the friendliness to hardwood, but it works great on ours. It is also great thickness for sitting on and laying on the floor. If we need any in the future we will definitely be buying from this company!
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Felt comes apart
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I bough this for my sons room which has hardwood floors to add some cushion and keep from rug surfing across the floor. Firstly , it does not stay put , it just slides right along with the rug. Secondly , the felt pieces easily come apart , easy for little fingers to pull the felt out and put right into their little mouths , as my son has been doing. Trying to coke up with a solution so I don't have to return this , being as big and bulky as it is. I don't understand the rave reviews. I should have just ordered a regular rug pad.
customer_reviews.author: Floraltherapist

customer_reviews.title: Great pad, NOT great non-slip
customer_reviews.text: This pad is super cushy and it fit perfectly under our rug, only problem is that in regards to being non-slip, we couldn't be more disappointed. The number of times I've almost slipped from one step on this rug in the short time we've had it is kind of alarming. And yes, there is heavy furniture on the rug/rug pad, slipping still happens. Wondering if this is normal, if I should return it, or skip the hassle of returning it and take a glue gun to the bottom of it to add grip? Hassle either way, but slipping all the time kind of sucks.
customer_reviews.author: MarSea L

customer_reviews.title: Thick mat, worth what I paid.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have purchased a rug mat/pad from this company. I liked the first one so much I purchased a second one for a different room. Its smaller than a 5x7 so no need to cut but you can tell a little because the rug dips on the edge. Just arrange the rug so the obvious side is under furniture or buy larger and cut. It makes a big difference in my rug with cushion. I'm happy with the purchase. Watch the price as it goes up from time to time. I gave it 4 stars only because it's too short but I can live with it.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Hebert

customer_reviews.title: Makes a real difference...
customer_reviews.text: This pad is durable. We bought one for a large rug in our main home before buying this smaller one for a vacation cottage. It's thick, resilient and just plain good quality. It makes a thin area rug feel luxuriant underfoot. And it helps preserve your floor from the hard fibers of your carpet backing--or, if you have (as we have) a sisal rug which allows dirt and dust to pass through to the floor, it saves your floor from being torn up by sand and dirt directly. Very pleased with both pads we've purchased from this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Nebti13

customer_reviews.title: Great pad, Amazon delivery could be better
customer_reviews.text: The size and thickness of the pad are as described, it fit perfectly under my 8x10in rug. The pad was simply rolled up in a box and Amazon left it on the stoop in pouring rain--unlike USPS and UPS carriers, who put packages inside our screen door both to protect them from the elements and to not leave them completely visible to potential thieves. The outside of the box was soaked when I got to it; luckily only a bit of water had seeped inside so I was able to dry the pad out. Soaked felt would be ruined and only good for breeding mold.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Great value and just the right add-on for an area rug
customer_reviews.text: I bought a rug for my living room and it's on top of laminate floors. After purchasing the rug, I read that the underlay of the rug can abrade the floors.... hence the need for a rug pad. I bought the thickest one because i wanted some squish and haven't been disappointed. The rug pad has a sticky side and a not sticky side, so i guessed the sticky side went up because I wouldn't think it would be good for the laminate floors. Three months in and still good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy T.

customer_reviews.title: Suits the purpose
customer_reviews.text: Due to a recent house fire, we needed to replace the pad under our 10 x 14 oriental rug. This pad was delivered quickly. Just as advertised. Nice quality, even, true to size. I did need to cut it back slightly. Cut easily with household scissors. Don't use a utility knife! When the cleaners returned my rug they tried to cut it back with a utility knife that clearly was not sharp enough, while pulling it at the same time! Started to shred. I had to make them stop and do it myself with more care. Overall, satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: CLG

customer_reviews.title: This padding works of me
customer_reviews.text: Don't understand all negative reviews seems most complain about it being slippery or not thick enough. I have porcelain tile floors and do use rug grippers plus I have used this on long runners. If it would be any thicker it would make your rug stick up to far and cause a trip hazard. Can't believe how incredible this padding makes my New Zealand wool rugs feel walking across bare foot. I ordered a second padding today. If you order make sure you have existing rug grippers or buy some. Suggestion maybe the company could also sale rug grippers and offer a package price
customer_reviews.author: Over 625 items ordered

customer_reviews.title: Received early but still in the box.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to put the pads down, because I'm still working on my house, but I can feel they're heavy and I'm sure they're topnotch. I just haven't had the chance to lay them out the way want them yet. Other than that, they came on time and are packed in a tight roll, so as not to take up a lot of room. Perfect for the steps I'll have to take to put them out. i also ordered two rugs to go on top of them. i'll post pics when the room is finished. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: RoseMary Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Plush and well made...worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Other past positive reviews were accurate. The pad quality is excellent. It is plush felt with a good backing. Definitely worth the money for padding a rug and protecting wood floors. I actually two pads for two large rugs, one 1/3 inch and the other 1/2 inch. The 1/2 inch gives our 10x13 rug a soft springing feel that makes that rug feel like it cost twice the money. The 1/3" is more firm as you might expect. But it still excellent. If you expect to open a door across the rug check your door clearance before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: MikeC

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be a perfectly adequate rug pad. My two year old was not super impressed with our "dirty" new carpet when we first opened the rug pad, although he immediately dumped his toys on it and started to play before we could unroll the actual rug. ;) It will certainly make the new rug a more comfortable playing surface for the kids. We were able to trim it with a pair of scissors to fit our rug, it was challenging to cut but certainly possible. This is not a "non-slip" rug pad, but we are using it under a large rug and anchoring it with furniture so it doesn't move around for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 100% recycled felt at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. I have used other rug mats that stuck to my wooden floors , damaging the surface. I found these recycled felt mats on Amazon to replace the mats. These are far superior. The are 100 percent recycled felt. They are dense enough to offer a cushion support without elevating the rug too high, causing a tripping hazard. I purchased 3 so far and will purchase more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Nessa

customer_reviews.title: Glad To HaveThis Under The New Rug
customer_reviews.text: This pad was easy to cut with regular kitchen shears. It's an 8 x 10, and the new rug was 7'10" x 9'10", kind of a hassle that rug sellers have to do that! But it arrived quickly. It did lay out with some bumps in it, but there doesn't seem to be a problem with the rug over it. I like the 1/3" thickness of this. It makes the new, very thin rug seem much more substantial. Glad we got it.
customer_reviews.author: BASO

customer_reviews.title: Get your scissors out
customer_reviews.text: The 8x10 pad itself was fine and seemed to be of good quality. Very soft and pliable. Easy to position and even adjust under the rug once placed on top of it. The only reason for my 4-star rating is that we had to trim off about 2-3 inches so it would fit the 8x10 rug we purchased on Amazon [  ] Other than that, this was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LJinWA

customer_reviews.title: Not extra cushiony like the cover pic, but is enough to be comfortable. Actually 8’x10’ in size.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t call this “extra cushiony” as it’s comparable to everything else out there. The picture is misleading as it is not that thick and sturdy. Definitely not a 1/2” thick felt like the cover pic makes it seem. BUT it was the best price I found that was thicker than 1/4” so I’m happy with it. Adds just enough to be comfortable. We have heavy furniture on it so we don’t have problems with slipping. If you don’t have heavy furniture you will need some sort of rug grippers to help with that. It’s listed as a 7’ x 10’ but it’s actually an 8’x10’
customer_reviews.author: ANewell

customer_reviews.title: Nothing great but better then nothing.
customer_reviews.text: We bought 5 of these on three separate occasions. Every time the pads were different. Sometimes thicker, sometimes thinner, sometimes very rough on one side. Calling these felt is a bit of a stretch, they're made of what looks like left over carpet fibers with plastic strands woven in too. Basically they're affordable and better then nothing but I'm not super impressed. They compress quickly and even new were not as thick as described.
customer_reviews.author: Super Saver

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I expected, but works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 8’x11’ size for our 9’x12’ area rug and it fits great. It wasn’t too small at all. It wasn’t quite what I expected though. I thought it would be more cushioned, but it’s very dense. It’s made of a felt material and was thinner than expected. Overall though it does what it’s supposed to. This helps to keep our rug from sliding around on our travertine floors and also adds a little more padding. In hindsight though, I would’ve gone with a thicker option.
customer_reviews.author: Jheneya

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the pad, was that of a more expensive one. thick and soft.  .
customer_reviews.text: i like everything about it. the pad was thick, soft and complemented my rug. Everyone thought I purchased a more expensive pad and rug. You can truly feel the difference in this pad versus some others even some more expensive one. this is much better! I always say, why pay more and get less. Pay less and get more.This pad is on a hardwood floor and still feels good.
customer_reviews.author: cookie

customer_reviews.title: Horrible chemical smell!
customer_reviews.text: The rug pad would work fine as intended but it smells horribly. It’s made with synthetic products and also coated with flame retardants which smells like chemicals - because they are. Gave me a terrible headache. I do not recommend this. Anything that smells this terrible cannot be good for your health. If you need a smaller rug pad this may be ok, but if you need one 5x7 or larger, be warned, it is full of chemicals and those toxic chemicals become a part of your home (and thus, your body)!
customer_reviews.author: neval

customer_reviews.title: Too slippery for wood floors!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pad to go under our master bed. The thickness and softness is fine. But the slipperiness is not ok. I’m trying to lay an area rug on top but the pad keeps shifting and throwing the rug off. I’m not psyched. In the past I have bought from other discount sites and I have been beyond happy with those pads. This time I was impatient and wanted it quickly so I ordered an amazon $$ equivalent. During the installation process I’m regretting my impatience!!
customer_reviews.author: Alison P

customer_reviews.title: Great rug pad!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this pad. It is thick and cuts easily as rugs are never exactly the size they say they are. Better too big than too small. I have it on a hardwood floor under an old oriental carpet, makes it feel like new. My dog loves the feel and has taken to laying on this rug in the den rather than the super thick oriental in the formal living room. I also have this pad under the super thick one and new I would be pleased with this purchase. The pad came promptly and is just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: S. S. Jaffe

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great pad, and I did read the reviews about ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m confused as to why when I order an 8x10, I have to get scissors and hurt my hand by cutting thick felt. It’s a great pad, and I did read reviews some of which mentioned cutting, but was hoping for the best. At least it doesn’t scratch floors and it does offer a nice padding, but hopefully the manufacturer can start cutting actual size. If this had been true to size, 5 stars all the way. It wasn’t even heavy to carry upstairs and we haven’t had it move from walking at all.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Great Comfort, Quality, and Value
customer_reviews.text: I have recently purchased a total of 10 rug pads from RUGPADUSA thru Amazon. The rug pads have ranged in several different sizes from very large to small. The quality is excellent. I’m confident that the new rug pads will protect my new luxury vinyl hardwood flooring. My family and I especially notice the comfort under foot. I highly recommend RUGPADUSA.
customer_reviews.author: grdatchr

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA - very nice carpet pad
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for under my new area rug. Purchased this pad because it was made in the USA and I'm happy I did. Adds softness and helps insulate/quiet the room as well. 1/2 was plenty thick for my needs - just unrolled it, placed it, then dropped the rug on top and we were ready to roll. I'll come back to rug pad central the next time I'm ready to buy. Quick shipping, great price - thanks for making a quality product here in the US. Keep advertising that benefit!!
customer_reviews.author: Barkingkitty

customer_reviews.title: Thickness nowhere near as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this rug pad, and unfortunately I bought 3 of them. This rug pad is nowhere near 3/8" thick, so the product description is blatantly misleading. I bought another rug pad on Amazon from Rug Pad USA that was also advertised as 3/8", and the Rug Pad USA one is much thicker and cushier. This one is much thinner and unevenly cut. If you're deciding between the two, don't make my mistake, and order from Rug Pad USA instead. Also - I realize this probably sounds like I work for Rug Pad USA, but I don't - I just happened to order both brands and am really unhappy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jules H.

customer_reviews.title: Just as ordered, and,
customer_reviews.text: These were just what I needed, though they were sent seperately and with 1 packing slip which made me have to call when one pad was delivered with the packing slip for 2 pieces, 2nd one did arrive finally. Also, maybe the pads should be cut slightly smaller than size, cause within a day of walking on it , there is some spread. Overall though, great customer service, fair price for the good quality pads. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Super thick.
customer_reviews.text: We have this under a large Ikea jute rug to provide a bit more cushion. It works well, but does slide around a tiny bit. Wish they had sprayed some type of rubber grip to either side just to keep it in place 100% of the time. Our rug is 9x12 or so, so even a large one can move around at the corners. But still, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Great rug pads
customer_reviews.text: These rug pads are perfect for rugs I have on my hardwood floors. I appreciate them being just a little large than the rug, so they can be custom fitted. These are much more plush than the pads from local rug shops for the same amount of money. They arrived nicely packed and they are easy to unroll and install.
customer_reviews.author: Kizzykizzy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kilim or other flatweave rug
customer_reviews.text: I got this primarily to provide padding for underfoot and protect my hardwood floor. A coffee table weights the rug, so slippage wasn’t as issue for me. (This is not designed for anti-slip, so factor that into your expectations.) I love that this makes a flatweave rug feel thick like a pile one, and means I can still use a heavy coffee table while protecting my floors and not ripping the rug. This was a great buy. For my purposes, this was a much better value than a traditional rug pad with anti-slip backing.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issues
customer_reviews.text: This thing was either not cut correctly at the factory or was an item that was purchased, trimmed to a smaller size, and then returned, as it's 2-3" too small on all sides. I bought a larger sized one for a different rug, and that was bigger than expected which was fine, because at least I could trim it.
customer_reviews.author: bluttmer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad for the price. It does come oversized so you have to cut it down. Cutting it with scissors is a disaster and clogs your scissors. Makes your hand hurt too. I recommend a box cutter to trim. See the pictures of all the fuzz that gets caught in the scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Britney Geidel

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy under my new rug. Nice thickness and the size was perfect. I didn't give it five stars because it moves. It is in a room that doesn't get too much traffic but I have to put it back in place every day. It is on a hardwood floor and slides. Not sure what to do about this but it's so comfy that I haven't bothered to figure it out yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Completely satisfied
customer_reviews.text: First off, let me say this rug pad is exactly as pictured. It not pretty and it’s not meant to be. Like the other reviews have mentioned, one side is textured and one is not. We opted to have the textured side up to grip the rug we laid on top of it, especially since we aren’t worried about our 10x14’ rug moving around. We initially received the wrong size- a 5x8 which would not due, but we returned that and they shipped the correct size immediately. So far so good! Our rug is far more comfortable now than when it was just laying on the hard wood floor.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten

customer_reviews.title: Brings your rug to life and gives your feet extra comfort
customer_reviews.text: This rug pad made a world of difference for the look and feel of my rug. I initially just had a 8x10 rug down on hardwood and it just looked flat (I realize it's a rug) but I was hoping for something that would be somewhat pleasant to walk on. After I purchased this rug pad, it made my new rug actually look a lot nicer (not flat and lifeless) and made walking on it a lot nicer. I did end up having to trim it up on one side because it was slightly bigger than my rug, but it was no biggie using everyday scissors.
customer_reviews.author: H.Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Adds Comfort under rug.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this past January to use with a rug (6'7" x 9'2") also purchased from Amazon. After reading the reviews regarding the measurements being slightly larger, I went with the smaller size and it worked out great. I felt this was a good quality rug pad and priced fairly. Might note that it does slide on hardwood floors, so I used a non slip pad underneath.
customer_reviews.author: MLK

customer_reviews.title: Product as described
customer_reviews.text: It’s exactly what I hoped it would be. It’s very thick and plush, which worked great with our low pile rug, but if you have high pile you may want a thinner pad. I did trim it a bit on one side. Make sure you have some sharp shears if you’re going to trim it. It was quite the task.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Exactly 8x10 in size, needs to be trimmed
customer_reviews.text: my only "complaint" is that it is exactly the size that it says it is. This probably makes some people happy, but I thought it would be slightly shrunken to fit an 8x10 rug, rather it goes right out to the edges and needs to be trimmed. Can trim to my liking. Arrived folded, rolled and packaged nicely, easy to carry through the house. Thick, good material, very happy. Will be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: StarMile

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and thickness for our sisal rugs
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly the right thickness and shape for some 6 x 9 sisal rugs we recently purchased. Going to order 2 more for our 8 x 10 rugs. Someone did question which side goes to floor--one side has a little bit of coating--a bit like lightly hairsprayed hair. I'm putting that side next to underside of rugs and the softest side next to floor. It could be the case that the coated side goes next to floor so any spills go thru pad and stop there, but I just want to softest next to new refinished wood floors.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalgrl

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried when I ordered this product after reading a lot of the bad reviews on here about how its really thin or whatever but it's 1/3" thick as promised and the dimensions were perfect. I have an odd sized rug so I had to cut it down but all it took were some fabric shears and it was fine. After placing it under my rug, there was a huge difference in comfort. 100% would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pad was exactly what we wanted
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a pad to fit an 8x10 area rug that would not harm the hardwood, would not leave a residue (many plastic/rubber pads "dry out" over time and leave powder/film), and would provide a moderate cushion. This pad fit the bill. It arrived quickly and was packaged very well. Had to cut it down to size which was not a problem with a sharp pair of scissors. The pad was worth the money and well made. Hope it stands up well to time.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Not the size you order
customer_reviews.text: Just as I had read in the other reviews- don't expect your rug pad to be the size that you order. Mine was approx 7 x 11 instead of 8 x 10. So, obviously does not fit entirely under the rug on one side and needed trimmed (good luck finding something that can cut through this thing) on the other. I went with the lower price. I ordered a different size from a competitor for another rug and it fit perfectly. It would have been worth paying a bit more to have the rug pad fit when I unrolled it.
customer_reviews.author: M. sutphin

customer_reviews.title: I’m sure there are better options
customer_reviews.text: Came folded in half, rolled up and stuffed in a box. After laying it on a flat surface for a few days ot still had a hump from the fold. Not cut to size nor is it squared. Took more time getting the hump out (steamer) and trimming so it could actually be used. It looks NOTHING like the photos.
customer_reviews.author: JustinThyme

customer_reviews.title: This is a great pad at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pad at a great price. We use this for a very old, large, expensive oriental rug and it is perfect. The pad protects the floor and protects the rug, and creates a nice cushion when we walk on it. This is very inexpensive compared to other pads of similar quality. When it arrived it had some wrinkles in it, but they smooth out once the rug is in place.
customer_reviews.author: A. Galer

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to Large Rugs
customer_reviews.text: This product does what it is intended to do. It gives my rug extra padding. I did have to trim a little off it so my rug could lay flat on the floor in order for my crawling baby to not trip himself. OtherwIse, I like the extra cushion it gives my rug and it has a non-slid backing so it’s not going to move. I definitely recommend for more cushioning of your rug.
customer_reviews.author: K. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Rug Pad Review
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the pad to put under an oriental rug. After the installation of the pad, the rug is much more comfortable to walk on. The pad has a very soft side, which I placed against the floor. The other side is a bit scratchier, but is fine against the underside of the rug. This pad is softer than the felt pads that I grew up with in my grandparent’s house. This pad is more susceptible to stretching if you don’t handle it properly. I looked at other places on line and think this pad is a good value. I got it sooner than I expected. I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for! As a novice to rugs and hardwood floors, I did not know plush felt pads were a thing. We got this since the bottom of our area rug had sticky residue from cheep slip pads. This did the trick. Protects our floors and adds plush cushion. We were all impressed by the new life this gives our rugs. We bought another one for another are a rug. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: LauraH

customer_reviews.title: Slide anyone...
customer_reviews.text: I love how this brings my area rug off the floor. It didn't stop the creak in the floor when walked on as I had hoped for. The kids can slide the carpet around the room with this felt carpet padding. So they give it a five star as well. I give it a five because it does the job well and it adds to the beauty of the rug. Would buy again and most likely we will.
customer_reviews.author: Raye Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: I had to cut off an inch on the length and width so that it wouldn't stick out from underneath my rug. It was very easy to trim with sharp kitchen sheers. I would suggest putting the softer side down (I have brand new wood floors so I didn't want to take a chance scuffing it up). The pad definitely makes my thin rug just even alittle softer to step on and I feel better knowing that my floor is protected. Good quality felt and it shipped super quick.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kain

customer_reviews.title: Soft, luxe protection
customer_reviews.text: We put down the rug pad on Saturday and needed to trim a few inches at each end, which was easy to do. After placing our area rug atop it, we were very pleased with the softness it added. It feels luxurious under our sock feet and our cat loves it too. I’m so pleased with this rug pad. We expect to have many years of protection for both our floors and our rug.
customer_reviews.author: L. B. Lear

customer_reviews.title: Great Rug Pad, just as described!
customer_reviews.text: We bought a new 8x10 rug and needed a pad underneath. Our rug is a low pile rug that was already fairly comfortable, but we still wanted padding. When this arrives, we opened the box and laid it out. Just as described and adds an extra comfort to our rug. We have a corner that is right near a walkway and we may need to get some rug tape for that since it slips a little bit (even with the rug pad). No big deal, and other than that, this rug pad is great!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pad for large area rug
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with purchase of pad to go under our new 8x10 area rug. It flattened out nicely. Took a couple of extra days to get here but well worth it, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scratchy Pad with odd materials
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea what this pad is made of but the bottom is very scratchy like material. Honestly I'm a little afraid it may damage my wood floor but we kept it because did not want to waste time shipping it back. I will never buy this type of pad again. See my pics for example of what you will receive
customer_reviews.author: SuperBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to go under my inexpensive area rug, The pad did have a lumpy area where the fibers were clumped together and pressed down during manufacturing - but I put the lump under the sofa area - and did not have to return or swap it out. Rug now feels much more plush underfoot. For the money it cost me - no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Queen

customer_reviews.title: Adds Comfort & Softness to my Area Rug
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pad to go under an area rug in my livingroom that was quite hard when placed on my hardwood floors. I have two small kids so a soft rug is a must! This pad really improved the comfort and softness of my livingroom rug. I would go with a slightly thicker pad in the future, but for the price this is great!
customer_reviews.author: k Blaylock

customer_reviews.title: Felt rug pad
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my new area rug for the living room. The rug now feels very comfortable to walk on. It is better now for when company comes over. I had to cut it down to size. I have an odd shaped rug. Make sure you have sharp scissors for that if you need to. I don't think it would help at all for keeping a rug in place. I notice that whenever we move furniture, the rug and pad gets bunched up. This pad is for comfort and protecting the floor. It is very good for what it is made for.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with this purchase. It is exactly what I wanted. I like the fact that it was from recycled material. It didn’t have any obnixious smell. I would have liked to get an even thicker one. But this works just fine. It is then enough if you need to cut it with a scissors to get the exact fit for whatever rug you are placing on top of it
customer_reviews.author: amyd

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This was even larger then we ordered, but you can easily cut it to shape. The thickness makes SUCH a difference! We purchased a carpet that was somewhat thick, but a friend suggested we get a pad to extend the life of the carpet. Our Granddaughter just started crawling and the pad has made the carpet SO comfortable to crawl on!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer DB

customer_reviews.title: Not measured properly; very hard to trim; overpriced
customer_reviews.text: You will have to cut this pad down and it is very hard and time consuming! Should be cheaper as a result! Ordered 10’ X 14’ rug pad to fit the same size rug. I had to cut 4” off the pad. It took me 20 minutes. My hand is red. My brand new scissors are dull. (See picture). Total waste of my time. No way these pads are measure and cut by hand. Should be cheaper to go through all I went through.
customer_reviews.author: Prof Carly

customer_reviews.title: Helps a lot.  no gripping or sticky
customer_reviews.text: This item does not grip the floor at all. one side is slippery and the other side is extra slippery. I used it on a laminate flooring. I had to use extra grip material. The thickness did help it did create extra comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Home hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We have cold hardwood floors that are not properly insulated. So much nicer to walk across the rug now. This comfy pad has made the living room rug a hot spot for puppy naps, and bone chewing. Highly recommend if you have a big, active dog, go with the anti skid option.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah McInnis

customer_reviews.title: Dangerously slippy on hardwood.
customer_reviews.text: I have an 8x10 rug on a hardwood floor. This provides nice protection but is almost FRICTION FREE. It slips around way more than the original rug did - its seriously like an ice rink/dangerous. My 8 lb puppy can move it all over the place - not good.
customer_reviews.author: Philip J. Filleul

customer_reviews.title: Transforms cheap rugs!
customer_reviews.text: We have hardwood floors throughout our home and I have purchased four large area rugs from overstock/Amazon. The rugs look great but are always thin. I finally bought one of these pads for a rug I purchased for our living room. Wow, what a difference!! It really feels plush and comfy under your feet!!
customer_reviews.author: RachichiLu

customer_reviews.title: Rugs feel softer and thicker thanks to this pad!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a nice, but extremely inexpensive 8' x 10' rug from Costco and knew I needed a rug pad underneath it. I have furniture on the rug so even though the rug pad doesn't provide much traction, nothing moves. What is also great is that the rug now feels a lot thicker than it really is and it is much softer as well. This was a great purchase and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: skoo

customer_reviews.title: Poor design, thin, dangerous, and not as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT 3/8” thick! Not even close! On top of that it says it’s 100% felt but there is an odd plastic coating on the bottom that is super slippery. Not sure why they’d use that on a rug pad since I tested it on the floor and it made the rug very slick and super dangerous. I tried it the other way around and it was still slippery. Poor design, dangerous, and not as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: No Instructions, No return label
customer_reviews.text: After trying for 30 minutes to get my 7 x 10 area rug on top of this pad I went on YouTube for instructions on how to do it. I also had to Google which side of pad should be on the floor. Of course I did it wrong the first time. This is not a premium product in my opinion. It is too thin. I suggest spending some time researching rug pads and buy one thicker than 1/3 of an inch and if it doesn't come with instructions go to YouTube. I am sorry I spent $50 on this.
customer_reviews.author: Mz. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the repackaged version to save a little money and it was in great shape, just 8'x12' so I had to cut off 2'. The material seemed to cut fine and doesn't appear to be fraying at all after cutting. We just had our floors refinished and I did not want the plain rug backing on the floors. There is a stickyish side to this pad so we put the softer felt did down directly on the floor and the other side touches the rug. Added bonus is that the rug is now even softer to walk on with the pad, like carpet!
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Infested
customer_reviews.text: We've had this over a year. Yes it was bigger than ordered and had to be cut which was not easy. It is cushy. Within the last month in 1 corner it has become infested with tiny ants or spiders and bits of the pad are breaking apart on the wood floor. This is in a new addition to our home. It is disgusting. I've cleaned it several times, vacuumed it, wiped the pad and floor and it is back. I will be throwing it out. Anyone else had this issue?
customer_reviews.author: Tricia O.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The pad itself is great, but should be made a couple inches smaller than rug sizes. We were told we could enter custom dimensions in the gift description section, which never came up as an option when ordering. So we ordered the same size as our rug and had to cut two of the sides down, which wasn’t super easy. Overall, the pad is soft and does what we need. It will slip on hardwoods if not anchored with furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Cristóbal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: I’m very happy with these rug pads. They are very soft under the rug. I like the no slip bottom. They were not hard to cut to size. They came quickly, and were packaged well. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Kate5

customer_reviews.title: Firm but cushy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to put under a rug that other reviews mentioned felt thin. It arrived and is the size we expected. It tells you which side goes down, which is helpful. It was slightly larger than our rug, so we had to trim a couple of inches off of one end, however, I'd rather it a big too big than too small. When I walked on it, I didn't feel much of a difference, so I intentionally dropped to my knees expecting it to bruise and hurt but it didn't do either. That tells me that while firm, this pad is cushy. We're very happy with our purchase
customer_reviews.author: T. Werkema

customer_reviews.title: Great rug pad that is easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second rug pad we have purchased for use under a large jute rug in a high-traffic area. We have two, large dogs, who bring in a lot of dirt and shed a lot of fur. I love how solid this is, since the rug is somewhat porous. It makes it easy to roll up the rugs and vacuum the dirt off the rug pad. It is also thick and adds nice padding, while protecting your floors!
customer_reviews.author: Skidge76

customer_reviews.title: I love this rug pad
customer_reviews.text: I love this rug pad. The size was correct as ordered. I have had it for over a month. It is thick and soft. I bought it in an 8 foot round. It doesn't slide. I have two area rugs near each other and I now have to buy another one of these felt rug pads because there is such a huge difference in quality in this 8 foot round felt rug pad and the pad I had under my other area carpet. The felt pad feels really nice underfoot.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compared to retail and other sites, good value for what is probably the same exact product.
customer_reviews.text: Standard rug pad, not ask thick as I expected and rug slides easily over it. Compared to retail and other sites, good value for what is probably the same exact product.
customer_reviews.author: TransylvaniaBlahBlahBlah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: Just as described. This rug pad is all felt, no rubber smell, just the right thickness (I got 1/3"), will sufficiently protect my new rug from hard brick floors. It is made from recycled materials and it required trimming to size, but these things are mentioned in the product description. I don't understand all the negative reviews about this rug pad. I'm glad I decided to go ahead with my purchase. This rug pad is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Pammy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be like me and try and put this rug pad down ...
customer_reviews.text: Don’t be like me and try and put this rug pad down right before people come over. Have your vacuum cleaner handy because it sheds like crazy! I had fuzz all over the house and myself! It’s not as squishy as i was hoping. I bought it for our living room so that my son wouldn’t get hurt falling over on our rug. (We have hardwood underneath it) however this was a good price for what i was Looking for and i kept It.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Felt Rug Pad, 8x10
customer_reviews.text: Not excited over this product as it does not prevent sliding. And it is too thick, making my rug sit too high so it's now a trip hazard. I read all the reviews and should have paid more attention to the negative ones. All in all the quality of the felt is good but it needs better resistance for vinyl or wood flooring.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mason

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Easily rips and sheds like a dog. Wish I never bought it and it slips all over the place. It doesn't add any cushioned support, only thickness underneath butbis very firm.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome under any rug!
customer_reviews.text: I love the thickness this adds to a rug, it helps them to wear better, and feels soooo nice. The carpet doesn't slide on them. Not so easy to cut unless you use a straight edge blade.
customer_reviews.author: Megabit

customer_reviews.title: Good thickness and quality to pad area rug
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this pad on a laminate wood floor under an area rug for about 4 months. It is a good thickness. It seems to be of good quality since it has not lost its cushion effect or become flatter. I trimmed the edges to fit under the area rug, and the edges have not frayed. I would buy this again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: MaryD

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality For Price
customer_reviews.text: This was the first rug pad I bought ever, as I wanted to ensure to protect the beautiful wood floors in my new home. I shopped around and read reviews debating how much Inshould spend on a natural rug pad. I gave this a try, it was on the lower side of the price points but could t be happier. Just needed to trim off a little bit to fit our 8 x 10 rug. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie0804

customer_reviews.title: Good value and soft!
customer_reviews.text: Great value and really helped add cushioning to my short area rug. Trimming it was a challenge but between an exacto knife and scissors I slowly managed. It is nice and thick...I am so glad I bought it. My intention was to help my dogs that jump down from my bed, but I love how soft it is for me!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

product_meta.title: RUGPADUSA - Basics - 8'x11' - 1/3" Thick - 100% Felt - Premium Comfort Rug Pad - Safe for All Floors and Finishes including Hardwoods - Made In the USA
feature_bullets: DURABLE CUSHIONING - Pad contains 28oz of felt per square yard. Thickness is approximately 1/3" throughout (actual thickness may very slightly in production). Dense thick felt adds soundproofing and insulation. Non-abrasive to protect rugs and floors from scratches. Adds extra comfort underneath rugs without extra bulking.
MADE IN THE USA - 100% recycled felt needle-punched to prevent moisture buildup. Odorless, low VOC's, and hypoallergenic.
SAFE FOR FLOORS - Chemical and adhesive free. Will not stain, strip, or damage hard surface flooring. Safe to use with hardwood, laminate, stone, tile, radiant heat, concrete, bamboo, and more.
NOTE TO CUSTOMER - This is not a non-slip rug pad and will not prevent rugs from shifting. This pad should only be used with large rugs that are anchored down by furniture.
TOTAL SATISFACTION - If you are unsatisfied with your purchase, please contact us (via Amazon Message) and we will be happy to assist you.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,192 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
